review: Works like a charm!  Unfortunately, our 2011 LG smart TV is not smart enough to keep up with the Amazon Prime app that Amazon now uses, so it was discontinued (I'm not sure whether LG or Amazon is at fault here, but it seems really chintzy that they would cut off a TV service like this, when a little software fix could have solved it).  So we had to purchase the Fire TV stick.  It's luckily very affordable and easy to install (with one exception--the two AAA batteries that power the Fire TV stick remote fit into the remote in the SAME direction (most batteries go in opposite + and - directions).  At first, I couldn't make the remote work and thought the batteries that came with it were dead.  When I took them out, I noticed that the + ends of the batteries were supposed to point the same way.  This should have been noted in the installation instructions, in my opinion.  As soon as I corrected the battery placement, everything worked perfectly, and we have enjoyed Amazon Prime very much.  I installed it in the extra HDMI input on my receiver which handles all the audio and video for the TV and used the included "dongle" to make the stick more visible to the remote's signal.  Listening to Pandora through the Fire TV Stick now on the surround sound for the TV now!
author: A. Matheny
